name: Holiday Inn Express Malaga Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had thought that Holiday Inns were of a uniformly high standard - did not realise that the "Express" are so down-market. We thought the hotel was very near the airport and would be easy to find after we had given back our hire car. It was not. We spent an hour driving around the suburbs trying to find it - after asking twice by phone how to find it, and at two garages - and we have University degrees! Part of the trouble is that the hotel does not have a fluorescent sign at a high level, as we expected - we saw Ibis & Novotel - also there are no indications that we could see. Eventually we found it, dropped off our luggage, returned our car and took a bus back. We did not know there was a bridge and were nearly killed crossing the motorway. The next day we took a taxi. It cost 15 euros! As it was New Year's Day we were charged double for our meal! That is to say, the menu was "unavailable", but we were given exactly the same food - at twice the price. Also, breakfast was included but as we had an early flight this was impossible, so we asked if we could have a drink & a cake to take instead. This was refused, even though there was an automatic machine selling these, so it would have been easy for the staff to provide.
reviews.title: Cheap: yes, convenient: not very

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was cheap. The accommodation was adequate. It was possible to have a meal at a fairly late hour (around 9.30 - but of course this is not late in Spain). The staff were friendly. That's the best we can say for it.
reviews.title: Good hotel for an early flight.

reviews.text: Good hotel for an early flight. It is about a 20 minute walk to the airport. Although we would recommend taking a taxi because if you walk you have to run across some very busy highways. The cost of the taxi for us at 5am was €14. The hotel was equipped with a restaurant and every kind of vending machine possible. The staff spoke English and they were at the desk 24/7. Our biggest complaint was that WiFi was not free. We had to pay €3.50 for an hour of WiFi to check into our flight. The rugs were also quite stained and worn. Our towels in our room were stained and we had to go ask for new ones. The shower was warm but the pressure would go way up and then down to just about a drizzle. The walls are also very thin. Our neighbors kids were yelling and screaming all night. If you have a very early flight this place will work, otherwise look somewhere else.
reviews.title: Location&Price

reviews.text: This hotel is not the easiet to get to even though you can see it from the road. Its close proximity to the airport is perhaps its greatest asset, especially if you have a super early morning flight. It is located at the exit immediately before the airport exit, so getting to the airport from this location is super easy and a no brainer if you're driving. Although the hotel has a "newish" look from the outside, the inside needs a bit of upgrading. The carpeting throughout the isles is heavily stained, which gives you an uneasy feeling. This is truly an economy hotel, so you really cannot expect a higher standard. The rooms are clean, but you tend to get that "unclean" feeling. The bathroom sinks are tiny and round, but the bathroom is reasonably large enough to not feel super cramped. Water tends to splash out when showering. While it has a thermostat for temperature control, we turned on the coldest setting only to get a blast of hot air. Although it was late December, the room was a bit warm. Opening the "swivel" window allows fresh air in, but you get the loud roar of the traffic from the main road next to the hotel. Breakfast service (included in the price) begins at 7:30am, but we were not able to enjoy the food because of our early flight. The gal at the check in counter did say they would have self serve coffee and yogurts available prior to 7:30am. The staff were very corial and polite. I even asked if I could have some self serve yogurt in the evening, since I was not going to enjoy the morning breakfast, and she said I could help myself. We were able to get a good nights rest, and the TV alarm sounded as programmed. The location of this hotel made our arrival at the airport very stress free, but I definitely would not recommend this hotel for anything other than a one night stay for an early flight, or a stop off point on a long drive. Parking is free, so that's an additional asset. There are some large shopping centers pretty close to this hotel.
reviews.title: No words

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worst hotel ever. The staff was less than helpfull in anything you could ask. Not updated rooms and lack of cleaning everywhere. Breakfast was practically unexistant. I have been in airport hotels all my life so I know what to expect when I am there, however this hotel is not meeting a minimum of decency.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: The most perfectly located hotel close to Malaga airport! It takes some roundabouts, some 20 EUR and some 15 minutes to get here, but when you get there - you can relax in quiet and nicely decorated rooms. This is HIE and they keep their simple, but high standards. You won't regret choosing HIE at Malaga airport.
reviews.title: Perfect for early/late arrival/departure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fair rooms, good sleep quality, breakfast included into basic - LOW rate. The breakfast was really good for such a hotel, we liked it. This is the nearest hotel to airport, but taxi drive to/from it is crazy 15 euro. Of course, there is a 2 euro bus, but it didn't seem right to look and wait for it at midnight after 20 hours flight. This + absence of a shuttle bus effectively made short distance not a privillege. Quick checkin and checkout. Everything was fine.
reviews.title: Exactly what you expect of a basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read a few previous reviews of the hotel I was nervous of what to expect. However, I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived before official check in time and was able to gain immediate access to my room. The reception staff were very friendly. The room was a typical HIE standard and experienced absolutely no problems whatsoever - no disturbance by aeroplane noise seeing it is fairly close to the airport. Getting there from the airport was very easy - take the number 19 bus from the arrivals at the airport and it is the first stop. At the bus stop there is a blue bridge crossing the busy main road and then a 200 yard walk. The same bus (and 2 others) can be taken to the city centre which are frequent and only take 20minutes again for 1.20 or 2 Euros dependent on which bus you get. The 'A' bus (stop outside the hotel) takes you back to the airport for 2 Euros so no 20 Euro taxis! Our stay at the hotel was relaxing and the decor is pretty good. The only one improvement I would suggest to the hotel is having better quality towels. Otherwise, a very good experience and nice friendly staff.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: We had no difficulty finding this property (as others have reported) using GPS. It is JUST before the exit to the airport and was very convenient to return our car. However, the property does NOT provide shuttle service to the airport so your options are either a) fixed price of E15 for a taxi or b) E2/person for the bus that stops in front of the petrol station next door. As we had an early flight on a Sunday morning and could not get definitive information on the bus schedule, we opted for the taxi. In retrospect, it would have also been an easy, less than 10-minute walk (we had only carry-on-sized rolling bags).
reviews.title: Close but no shuttle

reviews.text: Room was clean and appropriately sized for the cost/class (we used Priority Club points to book). There were only towels for 1 person in a two-bedded room but since the maids were in the hallway when we checked in we were able to grab more. We arrived well before the advertised check-in time and after a wait of only 10 minutes were able to secure our room.
reviews.title: Stay Away

reviews.text: The hotel is basic but fair value; What defeats it is the appalling location, right next to a busy main road and a railway line: There is no shuttle - a city bus runs from the airport and stops about 200 metres away, but his 200 metres is an open traffic area giving access to a busy construction material retailer, a restaurant, and a car-rental/garage firm, getting to and from the bus-stop, especially in darkness, is quite dangerous.
